translation.title: One Who Lives by the Teaching (2nd)

previous.name: One Who Lives by the Teaching (1st)

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 8. Yodhājīvavagga
segments.en: 8. Warriors

segments.pli: 74. Dutiyadhammavihārīsutta
segments.en: 74. One Who Lives by the Teaching (2nd)

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “‘dhammavihārī, dhammavihārī’ti, bhante, vuccati.
segments.en: “Sir, they speak of ‘one who lives by the teaching’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hotī”ti?
segments.en: How is one who lives by the teaching defined?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: “Mendicant, take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ;
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: uttari cassa paññāya atthaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: But they don’t understand the higher meaning.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu: ‘bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī’.
segments.en: That mendicant is called one who studies a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhu yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ deseti, uttari cassa paññāya atthaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu: ‘bhikkhu paññattibahulo, no dhammavihārī’.
segments.en: That mendicant is called one who advocates a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhu yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena sajjhāyaṃ karoti, uttari cassa paññāya atthaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu: ‘bhikkhu sajjhāyabahulo, no dhammavihārī’.
segments.en: That mendicant is called one who recites a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhu yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati, uttari cassa paññāya atthaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant thinks about and considers the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu: ‘bhikkhu vitakkabahulo, no dhammavihārī’.
segments.en: That mendicant is called one who thinks a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: Take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ;
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: uttari cassa paññāya atthaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: And they do understand the higher meaning.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhu, desito mayā pariyattibahulo, desito paññattibahulo, desito sajjhāyabahulo, desito vitakkabahulo, desito dhammavihārī.
segments.en: So, mendicant, I’ve taught you the one who studies a lot, the one who advocates a lot, the one who recites a lot, the one who thinks a lot, and the one who lives by the teaching.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
segments.en: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

segments.pli: Etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha bhikkhu, mā pamādattha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī”ti.
segments.en: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicant! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed,…
